trans-unit.source: Next, you will create a new mobile service to replace the in-memory list for data storage.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will create a new mobile service to replace the in-memory list for data storage.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the navigation pane, click **+NEW**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the navigation pane, click **+NEW**.

trans-unit.source: plus-new
trans-unit.target: plus-new

trans-unit.source: Expand **Compute** and **Mobile Service**, then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Compute** and **Mobile Service**, then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: mobile-create
trans-unit.target: mobile-create

trans-unit.source: This displays the **New Mobile Service** dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **New Mobile Service** dialog.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create a mobile service** page, select **Create a free 20 MB SQL Database**, then type a subdomain name for the new mobile service in the **URL** textbox and wait for name verification.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create a mobile service** page, select **Create a free 20 MB SQL Database**, then type a subdomain name for the new mobile service in the **URL** textbox and wait for name verification.

trans-unit.source: Once name verification completes, click the right arrow button to go to the next page.
trans-unit.target: Once name verification completes, click the right arrow button to go to the next page.

trans-unit.source: mobile-create-page1
trans-unit.target: mobile-create-page1

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Specify database settings** page.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Specify database settings** page.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.

trans-unit.source: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile service, you can instead choose **Use existing Database** and then select that database.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile service, you can instead choose **Use existing Database** and then select that database.

trans-unit.source: The use of a database in a different region is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.
trans-unit.target: The use of a database in a different region is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.

trans-unit.source: In **Name**, type the name of the new database, then type **Login name**, which is the administrator login name for the new SQL Database server, type and confirm the password, and click the check button to complete the process.
trans-unit.target: In **Name**, type the name of the new database, then type **Login name**, which is the administrator login name for the new SQL Database server, type and confirm the password, and click the check button to complete the process.

trans-unit.source: mobile-create-page2
trans-unit.target: mobile-create-page2

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When the password that you supply does not meet the minimum requirements or when there is a mismatch, a warning is displayed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When the password that you supply does not meet the minimum requirements or when there is a mismatch, a warning is displayed.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you make a note of the administrator login name and password that you specify; you will need this information to reuse the SQL Database instance or the server in the future.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you make a note of the administrator login name and password that you specify; you will need this information to reuse the SQL Database instance or the server in the future.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a new mobile service that can be used by your mobile apps.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a new mobile service that can be used by your mobile apps.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will add a new table in which to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will add a new table in which to store app data.

trans-unit.source: This table will be used by the app in place of the in-memory collection.
trans-unit.target: This table will be used by the app in place of the in-memory collection.
